Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                     M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media          feature subtitle 1          feature text                             The M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media , offered through the NYU School of Professional Studies Center for Publishing, provides you with a solid foundation in book and magazine publishing, with a major focus on digital media. The program develops the core competencies of content creation and editing, while also emphasizing the business, digital media, and marketing skills that are necessary to secure leadership roles in the industry.   With a goal of exposing you to "real-world, real-workplace" scenarios, the curriculum reflects the most current industry trends, including best practices in e-books, apps, and mobile platforms and video. Your studies begin with core courses that provide a comprehensive framework in the essential elements of the publishing process. Media specialization courses delve into the most critical business aspects of the industry and provide the expertise needed to master them.       The core course requirements are designed to provide you with an in-depth understanding of the most important elements of publishing. While completing the core courses, you also take courses from three media specializations: media content development, media marketing and distribution, and media profitability. Advanced seminars provide a thorough exploration of key industry topics. You complete the program with a capstone project that allows you to draw on the skills you’ve acquired.   While rigorous coursework is key to your success in the program, you also will be provided with numerous opportunities to expand your publishing knowledge outside of the classroom. In addition to industry events and visits, the M.S. in Publishing: Digital and Print Media has developed a strong global program. As the publishing industry becomes not only more digital, but global, an understanding of international publishing practices is imperative. Students are invited to apply for trips to international book fairs and conferences, where they can volunteer their time in return for the opportunity to participate in global events and discussions. In recent years, students have served as marketing, publicity, and educational programming volunteers at the Frankfurt, London, Abu Dhabi, and Sharjah (UAE) international book fairs and at the FIPP International Magazine conference in Rome. These opportunities are underwritten by department grants for a select number of students.           Program Location : NYU Midtown Center                 From the Director                                                       Andrea Chambers        "Our goal is to prepare today’s professional for success and career satisfaction." Students must complete the requirements in place during the term in which they begin their certificate. For current requirements, course schedules, and course descriptions, please click here .      From the acquisition and editing of books and magazine articles to copyediting them into perfect prose, this program equips students with the specific skills they need to pursue a career in editing. Learn how to think like an editor, whether in books or magazines, how to work with writers, and how to best mold an article or manuscript to reflect the voice and point of view you and your author want. Master the essentials of copyediting, proofreading, and grammar.    Upon completion of this program, students have attained the following:       Employable skills in copyediting, line editing, proofreading, and grammar in various formats.    A working knowledge of how to acquire a book or magazine article.    A full understanding of the editing process and the role of an editor in the digital age.     Certificate in Book Publishing (Print and Digital)        Please note that requirements may change. Students must complete  the requirements in place during the term in which they begin their  certificate. For current requirements, course schedules, and course  descriptions,  please click here . This certificate offers a unique professional credential for those who   are interested in beginning or furthering their careers in book   publishing, both in traditional publishing houses and in the growing   e-book industry. Courses are taught by working publishing professionals   and provide thorough overviews of the core functions of the industry, as   well as focused study on key topics such as the impact of, and the   opportunities arising from, new digital media. Upon completion of this flexible program, students are equipped with:       Comprehensive working knowledge of major publishing functions.    In-depth training in a specific skill set, such as editorial content   development, marketing, publicity, finance, or digital media.    Invaluable networking opportunities with a peer group of working adults and industry professionals.    A highly respected professional credential that is recognized by the publishing industry.  Certificate in Magazine and Website Publishing        Please note that requirements may change. Students must complete  the requirements in place during the term in which they begin their  certificate. For current requirements, course schedules, and course  descriptions,  please click here . Professionals currently working in print or digital publishing now   need to understand how to create, sell, and market content online and   through other digital platforms. This certificate offers a broad overview of magazine—both print and   digital—and website publishing for those interested in launching or   furthering their careers in these areas. Students gain specific,   targeted skills that make them more valuable as employees in an industry   whose focus is increasingly shifting to the web and to interactive   media. Those who currently work for print publications develop an   understanding of how traditional and online platforms interrelate in   regard to content development and financial models. Those launching   publishing careers receive a thorough understanding of the industry as a   whole, from content creation and editing to business and marketing   skills, making them far more likely to be hired for publishing   positions. Upon completion of this flexible program, students are equipped with:    Skills for writing and editing content across platforms, including magazines, websites, mobile apps, and blogs.    An understanding of financial models for print and digital media.    Online marketing and publicity techniques.    Circulation strategies for print publications and audience development and retention strategies for websites. Expertise in digital publishing platforms and devices.
